body: This will `break` the `while (!work_stack.empty())` loop. I don't think it will be able to find patterns like `A->B->C` (there is an example with 2 nodes as well but we are talking about fusion so I make it three) in a graph with edges `A->C`, `A->B`, and `B->C`. `C` is the destination of the first outgoing edge from `A`. It will be top of stack, won't pass `*node_checker`, will `break` the `while` loop, and go to a new `fi`.
